questions.question: Which of the below form(s) the exposition of Perfecting Prata?

choices.answer: Kitchen in Ben and Albert's home
Ben wanting to talk to Albert
Introduction of Ben and Albert as characters
Albert taking the initiative to make prata
Ben has a girlfriend and Albert disapproves of it
Ben does not want braces but Albert insists on making a set for him
Ben wants to talk about his mother but Albert does not want to
Ben wants to make prata for his girlfriend but Albert does not approve

questions.question: What is the conflict (i.e. struggle between two opposing forces) within Perfecting Prata?

choices.answer: Ben: You’re the only one I can talk to about her…but you refuse to talk!
Ben: Are you trying to make me forget Ma or something?
Albert: Your ma was a real mother. I’m not qualified to be a father
Albert: you’ve reminded me that she’s not here anymore

questions.question: Which quote best represents the conflict in Perfecting Prata?

choices.answer: He lost the house
Ben became so sick he had to go to the hospital three times
The plants in the garden died
Ben cried like a little girl

questions.question: Why caused Albert to believe that he is an inferior father?

choices.answer: Ben and Albert have an argument and Albert feels he is a failure
Albert makes prata for Ben
Ben assures Albert that he has been a good father

questions.question: When and where does the climax (i.e. most emotional moment) occur in Perfecting Prata?
What events form part of the rising action?

choices.answer: Ben and Albert argues over the cost of Ben's braces
Ben wants to make prata for his mother and makes a mess of the kitchen
Ben and Albert argues over Ben wanting to make prata for his girlfriend
Albert makes prata for his son
Ben's girlfriend joins Albert and Ben for a prata dinner
Ben assures Albert that he is a good father
Albert tries his best to make prata just as his wife did

questions.question: What happens during the falling action?

choices.answer: dad
husband
role model

questions.question: Complete the quote: If you’ve taught me nothing, then how come I know I will be a good ____ one day when I have kids?
Which of the below is the final quote in the resolution?

choices.answer: They don’t taste like Ma’s. But Pa…they’re perfect
You think that just because I miss ma, I never notice the things you do
you measure me when I am asleep
you go through my schoolwork every night

questions.question: What does Ben mean when he says "They don’t taste like Ma’s. But Pa…they’re perfect"

choices.answer: His father is better at making prata compared to his mother
His father's parenting style is different from his mother
Ben is grateful that his father has brought him up well
True
False

questions.question: Theme is the central idea that the narrative is based on.
Which of the below are possible themes of Perfecting Prata?

choices.answer: A family without both parents will never be "perfect".
Communication between family members is key to improving relationships
Mothers make better parents compared to fathers
